Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper

Class InstrumentedComparatorHelper<X>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.BaseHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.BaseComparatorHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.InstrumentedComparatorHelper<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the underlying type (must be Comparable).
All Implemented Interfaces:
Helper<X>, Instrument, NonComparableHelper<X>, AutoCloseable, Comparator<X>
Direct Known Subclasses:
InstrumentedComparableHelper
public class InstrumentedComparatorHelper<X> extends BaseComparatorHelper<X>
Helper class for sorting methods with instrumentation of compares and swaps, and in addition, bounds checks. This Helper class may be used for analyzing sort methods but will run at slightly slower speeds than the super-class. TODO merge this class with InstrumentedHelper.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_RUNS

      public static final int DEFAULT_RUNS
      Default value of runs when not specified in config.init (Help section). Its only significance actually is that it's the initial number of samples in the statistics array. It shouldn't matter too much because those arrays will grow as needed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • InstrumentedComparatorHelper

      public InstrumentedComparatorHelper(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int n, Random random, int nRuns, Instrument instrumenter, Config config)
      Constructor for explicit random number generator.
      Parameters:
      description - the description of this Helper (for humans).
      comparator - the Comparator of X to be used.
      n - the number of elements expected to be sorted. The field n is mutable so can be set after the constructor.
      random - a random number generator.
      nRuns - an (explicit) number of runs (for statistics).
      instrumenter - an implementer of Instrument.
      config - the configuration (note that the seed value is ignored).

    • InstrumentedComparatorHelper

      public InstrumentedComparatorHelper(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int n, Config config)
      Constructs an instance of InstrumentedComparatorHelper with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      description - A string providing a description for the InstrumentedComparatorHelper instance.
      comparator - A comparator used to compare elements of type X.
      n - An integer specifying the size or extent of the data to be handled.
      config - A configuration object containing additional settings or parameters.

    • swapInto

      public void swapInto(X[] xs, int i, int j)
      Method to perform a stable swap using half-exchanges, i.e. between xs[i] and xs[j] such that xs[j] is moved to index i, and xs[i] through xs[j-1] are all moved up one. This type of swap is used by insertion sort.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of Xs.
      i - the index of the destination of xs[j].
      j - the index of the right-most element to be involved in the swap.

    • swapIntoSorted

      public void swapIntoSorted(X[] xs, int i)
      Method to perform a stable swap using half-exchanges, and binary search. i.e. x[i] is moved leftwards to its proper place, and all elements from the destination of x[i] through x[i-1] are moved up one place. This type of swap is used by insertion sort.

      NOTE: this needs more precision.

      Parameters:
      xs - the array of X elements, whose elements 0 through i-1 MUST be sorted.
      i - the index of the element to be swapped into the ordered array xs[0...i-1].

    • inversions

      public long inversions(X[] xs)
      Count the number of inversions of this array.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      the number of inversions.

    • swapConditional

      public boolean swapConditional(X[] xs, int i, int j)
      Method to perform a stable swap, but only if xs[i] is less than xs[j], i.e. out of order.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements under consideration
      i - the index of the lower element.
      j - the index of the upper element.
      Returns:
      true if there was an inversion (i.e., the order was wrong and had to be fixed).

    • swapConditional

      i - the index of the lower element.
      j - the index of the upper element.

      public void copyBlock(X[] source, int i, X[] target, int j, int n)
      Copies a block of elements from the source array to the target array and updates instrumentation.
      Parameters:
      source - the array from which elements will be copied.
      i - the starting position in the source array.
      target - the array to which elements will be copied.
      j - the starting position in the target array.
      n - the number of elements to be copied.

    • distributeBlock

      public void distributeBlock(X[] source, int from, int to, X[] target, Function<X,Integer> f)
      Distributes a block of elements from the source array to the target array using the specified function. The method tracks the number of elements copied and the number of operations performed.
      Parameters:
      source - the source array from which elements are to be distributed
      from - the starting index in the source array (inclusive)
      to - the ending index in the source array (exclusive)
      target - the target array to which elements are to be distributed
      f - a function that will be applied to elements during distribution

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the current resource and performs necessary cleanup. This method logs statistical information if the instrumenter is configured to show statistics and a valid stat pack is available. The logged information includes the resource's identifier and description along with the statistical data. After logging, the method proceeds to call the superclass's close method to ensure proper resource cleanup.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Helper<X>
      Overrides:
      close in class BaseHelper<X>

    • getRandomArray

      public X[] getRandomArray()
      Method that retrieves the current value of randomArray.
      Returns:
      an X[] unless random() was never invoked in which case we return null.

      Parameters:
      description - a description of the helper being cloned
      comparator - the comparator used for comparing elements
      N - the size parameter for the helper
      Returns:
      a new instance of InstrumentedComparatorHelper initialized with the specified parameters

    • showFixes

      public String showFixes(X[] xs)
      Analyzes the given array and returns a string detailing the number of fixes and inversions in the array.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of X objects to be analyzed for fixes and inversions
      Returns:
      a string containing the total count of fixes and inversions

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the instrumenting helper, providing details about its description and the number of elements it contains in a formatted manner.
      Overrides:
      toString in class BaseHelper<X>
      Returns:
      a formatted string describing the instrumenting helper, including its description and the number of elements.

      public static int getRunsConfig(Config config)
